summary: Build “DarkPattern Shield”, a hackathon-ready smart-city styled public safety awareness web app focused on social media manipulation and subscription fraud, using HTML/CSS/Bootstrap + Flask + SQLite with simple keyword-based risk scanning.
architectural_notes: Tech stack decision: Frontend uses HTML/CSS/Bootstrap with Flask-rendered templates.
Backend decision: Python Flask application providing routes for detector, quiz, reporting, and dashboard.
Database decision: SQLite used for prototype persistence of scam reports.
Logic constraint: Use basic keyword-based heuristics for risk scoring; avoid heavy AI/ML.

existing_features.title: Create the DarkPattern Shield homepage with a clear, public-safety-oriented explanation of modern dark patterns (e.g., “₹1 trial → ₹599 auto-renew” scams seen in social media ads), and include three prominent CTA buttons: “Check Offer Risk”, “Report Scam”, and “Know Your Risk”.

Implement a consistent modern, minimal “smart city cyber safety” visual theme across the app (colors, typography, spacing, component styling) that looks hackathon-ready and product-like, avoiding a blue/purple-dominant palette.

Build the “Subscription Trap Detector” page: provide a single text input where users can paste an ad link or offer text; scan the input using basic keyword matching (e.g., trial, auto-renew, subscription, ₹, /month); and display a Risk Level (Low/Medium/High) with a clear warning message plus a short educational note explaining dark patterns in simple language.

Build the “Personal Digital Risk Test” page as a 5-question quiz focused on subscription/cancellation awareness and social media ad behaviors; compute a “Digital Vulnerability Score”; show the score with an interpretable label; and present exactly 3 personalized safety tips derived from the user’s answers/score.

Implement the “Scam Reporting” module UI: a simple form allowing users to submit scam text and/or a screenshot description (text-only), choose a scam category (Subscription Trap, Fake Discount, OTP Scam), and submit the report.
Create a small “Reports Dashboard” view (can be embedded in the Scam Reporting page or as a separate page) that displays total reports and the most common scam type, updating after new submissions.

Create the “Browser Extension Concept” page with a visual mockup of a browser warning popup (implemented in UI) and a clear explanation of how an extension would warn users before payment; do not implement any real extension functionality.

Add app navigation so users can reach: Home, Subscription Trap Detector, Personal Digital Risk Test, Scam Reporting (with dashboard), and Browser Extension Concept; ensure CTAs on the homepage route correctly.
Generate and include a small set of static brand/illustration assets and render them from frontend/public/assets/generated to enhance the product-like “smart city cyber safety” feel.

Produce an exportable, complete copy of the full project source code (backend and frontend) as a single downloadable package, ensuring it includes all files needed to build and run the app locally (including configuration files already present in the project).
Add a top-level documentation file that explains how to obtain/export the full source code from the app/project workspace and how to run it locally, using only English user-facing text.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create Homepage with problem explanation, real-life hidden subscription examples, and CTA buttons (Check Offer Risk / Report Scam / Know Your Risk) in modern minimal smart-city UI
Implement Subscription Trap Detector: user input (ad link or offer text), keyword scan (trial/auto-renew/subscription/₹/month), show Risk Level (Low/Medium/High) with warning + educational note
Implement Personal Digital Risk Test: 5-question quiz, compute Digital Vulnerability Score, show results with 3 personalized safety tips

Implement Scam Reporting Module: form for scam text/screenshot description, categorize scam types (Subscription Trap/Fake Discount/OTP Scam), store in SQLite, dashboard with total reports + most common scam type
Create Browser Extension Concept Page: visual mockup of browser warning popup and explanation (no real extension functionality)
Produce complete runnable prototype codebase: Flask backend, HTML templates with Bootstrap, SQLite integration, clean folder structure, dummy data where needed, deployment-ready

Add backend support (single Motoko actor) to persist scam reports and compute summary stats, including: total number of reports and the most common scam type. Expose query/update methods needed by the frontend to submit reports and fetch dashboard stats.
Provide an export/download of the full project source code (complete codebase package)

Create a top-level `README.md` at the repository root that documents the DarkPattern Shield project in English, including: project overview, key features/pages, tech stack, prerequisites, local development setup (frontend + IC canister), how authentication works (Internet Identity), and how to export/download the full source code using the existing export scripts and docs.
